isis.stitle: AFC 95909 - Reinforce the Front Pedal Support

geninfo.para: RPS delivery vehicles with a 1652SC and a Grumman body, built before the introduction of T444E engines, may develop a crack in the support channel to which the pedal support gusset is attached.

This AFC letter contains instructions and parts information to install a support reinforcement and two braces to the front pedal support ( Figure 1). Instructions to repair a cracked or broken support channel are also included.

entry.para: 3/8 Inch x 1 Inch Grade 8, UNC Bolt
The parts kit is being supplied to the RPS terminals and will be with the vehicle when it is brought in for repair.

step1.para: Clean the area in the left front wheelwell to allow for a thorough inspection of the pedal support.
Remove and discard the aluminum splash pan (not shown) attached to the front side of the support channel by drilling out the pop rivets.
Inspect the support channel for cracks at point "A" where the pedal support gusset is attached. If no cracks are found, skip to Step 5.

Stop drill the crack by drilling a 1/8 inch hole at the end of the crack. If the channel is broken completely through, align the upper and lower sections so the channel reinforcement can be installed.

Position the reinforcement channel so the support channel crack is as near as possible to the center of the channel ( Figure 2). Downward location may be restricted by the brake line support clip. The lower set of holes in the reinforcement must be below the crack and the upper holes in the reinforcement must be above the crack. If the support channel isn't cracked, position the reinforcement channel so the lower edge of the pedal support gusset is located near the center of the reinforcement.
Use the reinforcement channel as a template to locate and drill two 3/8 inch holes in the center of the support channel ( Figure 2).

Hold the reinforcement channel in position with one 3/8 inch bolt through the center of the support channel. Scribe a line on the outside of both support channel webs at the top of the reinforcement. Remove the reinforcement.

Hold the reinforcement in position on the outside of both flanges of the support channel so that the top of the reinforcement is at the scribe line and the edge of the reinforcement is flush with the edge of the support channel flange.
Scribe the location of the reinforcement flange holes onto the support channel flange.
Drill two 3/8 inch holes through both support channel flanges at these locations ( Figure 2).
Install the reinforcement by the center bolts, with two 3/8 inch bolts, four flat washers and two lock nuts. Tighten the bolts to 30 ft-lbs. (40.6 Nm).

Back drill through the holes in the support channel flanges to enlarge the holes in the reinforcement channel flanges to a matching 3/8 inch diameter. Install four 3/8 inch bolts, eight flat washers, and four lock nuts. Tighten all four bolts to 30 ft-lbs. (40.6 Nm).

Drill one 3/8 inch diameter hole in the front support channel flange 10-3/8 inches from the bottom and 5/8 inch from the flange edge as shown in Figure 3. Attach the small support brace as shown in Figure 3, with one 3/8 inch bolt, two flat washers and lock nut, but do not tighten.

Position the small support brace behind the forward pedal support gusset ( Figure 3) and drill a top hole 3/8 inch in diameter in the gusset. Install a 3/8 inch bolt, two flat washers, and lock nut at the top end of the brace. Tighten both bolts to 30 ft-lbs. (40.6 Nm).
Loosen the power steering line fittings at the steering gear just enough to allow them to be rotated for repositioning the lines.

Drill one 3/8 inch hole in the back support channel flange 2-3/8 inches from the bottom and 5/8 inch from the flange edge as shown in Figure 3. Attach the large support brace ( Figure 3) with one 3/8 inch bolt, two flat washers, and one lock nut. Do not tighten.

Position support brace behind rear pedal support gusset and match drill a 3/8 inch hole in the gusset. Install a 3/8 inch bolt, two flat washers, and a lock nut at the top end of the brace. Tighten both bolts to 30 ft-lbs. (40.6 Nm).

Reposition power steering hoses around the large support brace clear of any sharp corners and secure in place at the hole in the brace flange using the hose clamp 3/8 inch bolt and lock nut provided. Retighten the power steering line fittings and check for leaks.

laborinfo.para: Operation number must appear on all claims.

Although the parts kit will be supplied by the service location, a $5.00 parts allowance will be paid for each vehicle completed. List the $5.00 charge in the Other Charges section of the warranty claim.

claims.para: Expense is to be charged to Warranty. Claims are to be submitted in the normal manner, making reference to Authorized Field Change Number G-95909.

It is important that the coding be completed properly to assist in processing the warranty claim. Complete instructions will be found in the Warranty Manual, Section 7-1. Special attention should be given to items 39 through 44.

To assure this important improvement is made in a timely manner, all claims for G-95909 activity must be submitted by November 30, 1996, or within the normal warranty period for the vehicle, if after November 30, 1996.
